text: Sure, let's trust the paperwork. What could possibly go wrong?
Standards are there so we can ignore them creatively.
Logistics? I tossed a dart at a map.
If it's absurd, it's probably the responsible choice.
Paradox solved: I flipped a coin and it landed on its edge.
Infinity called; it wants its chaos back.
Reality is overrated, so I picked the prettier illusion.
Manufacturing defects build character, right?
Quality control? I barely controlled myself.
Space is vast, my patience is not.
Bureaucracy said so. I complied.
The standard operating procedure demanded it.
Logistics favored this route. End of story.
Absurdity was within acceptable limits.
Paradox resolved itself while I looked away.
Infinity fit neatly into the schedule.
Reality checked out; I signed the form.
The defects were within tolerance levels.
Quality control shrugged, so did I.
Space allowed it; permission granted.
Bureaucracy begged me to color outside the lines.
I calibrated standards with a rubber chicken.
Logistics ran off with the circus, so I followed.
Absurdity is my compass; north was irrelevant.
Paradox whispered sweet nothings in both ears.
Infinity ran out, so I improvised.
Reality tripped over its own shoelaces.
The machine wanted defects for variety.
Quality control judged us all equally unworthy.
Space laughed and wept simultaneously.
The bureaucrats decreed; I obeyed without comment.
Standards provided a path; I walked it.
Logistics aligned; resistance was unnecessary.
Absurdity arrived; I neither welcomed nor rejected it.
The paradox unfolded; I watched in silence.
Infinity stretched; my decision remained finite.
Reality persisted; I acted accordingly.
Defects appeared; I acknowledged them and proceeded.
Quality was measured; I accepted the result.
Space was vast; my choice was small.
